source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk8
evidence_span: Zircaloys are extensively used for various nuclear energy applications such as nuclear fuel cladding, grids, and channels in light water reactors.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk8
evidence_span: They are also used in heavy water reactors as pressure and calandria tubes.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk8
evidence_span: Among many of the zirconium based alloys, Zircaloy-2 and Zircaloy-4 find extensive use in LWRs.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk8
evidence_span: Among many of the zirconium based alloys, Zircaloy-2 and Zircaloy-4 find extensive use in LWRs.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk8
evidence_span: In particular, Zircaloy-2 is commonly used in BWRs for cladding tubes and grids while the channels are fabricated using Zircaloy4.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk8
evidence_span: In particular, Zircaloy-2 is commonly used in BWRs for cladding tubes and grids while the channels are fabricated using Zircaloy4.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk8
evidence_span: Whereas, in PWRs, both the cladding and grids are made from Zircaloy-4.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk8
evidence_span: All these alloy tubings are manufactured using Pilger mill process from tube shells, which render them textured with preferred orientation of grains.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk8
evidence_span: The specific textures developed depend on the details of the tube reduction schedules as well as thermal treatments.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_015_chunk8
